name: Mercure Figueira da Foz

reviews.text: Spent one night in Figueira in mid September, and chose this hotel because of the reviews and location, I wasn't disappointed. Hotel is directly across the street from the beach and walking distance to restaurants, cafes, and the casino. Which is what a love in a hotel's location. The hotel itself was also very nice, got a room with a balcony facing the beach. I was given a closed in balcony, room 301, which was nice but an open balcony would've been better. Still the view of that enormous beach is amazing. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, and the hotel was very clean. I forgot my 5 month old daughter's stuffed sleeping lamb in room and when I called later that day the hotel said nothing was recovered from that room, I guess it's to be expected at any hotel :(. I was able to find a parking spot right in front of the hotel, which was free, I guess going in mid september has it's benefits, even though Figueira was pretty dead at the time. This was my first time in Figueira da Foz, and only spent one night, but I believe I picked the right hotel. You cross the street and your on the sand, getting to the water isn't as easy(did I mention the beach is huge?), and your a short walk from the food and booze. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Wow, that's a huge beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All comes down to expectation, and this is a good little 4 star hotel by the beach. It's good value for money, and the staff are very helpful There's wifi included and a clean comfortable room.
reviews.title: Good hotel, convenient location.

reviews.text: It's a bit old, so expect some wear and tear. There's a automatic shoe shine machine on the first floor - old school!
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel facing the beach

reviews.text: I would happily stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: I usually prefer smaller hotels in seaside towns but I reckons this is the best place to stay in Figueira da Foz. The long rows of balconies facing the large beach may not look beautiful from outside but once you are in your room you can appreciate a wide ocean view. The balconies are large and also get you some privacy, ideal for a drink looking at the sunset. The rooms are comfortable and large as you expect from a 4 star hotel of this kind.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Figueira may be the place to be in the summer but in April it's dead. We were there on a windy Sunday night. We had a ocean view room. The view was great but the room was on the small side and furnishings are starting to show age. The staff were very welcoming and the internet worked great. Parking was easy (directly in front of hotel). We were surprised that there weren't more eating choices nearby, but as I said maybe it was because it was off season. Other than that it was a rather unremarkable visit. Too cold and windy to visit the beach and not much else to do.
reviews.title: OK For One Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good place to stay and in general nothing really wrong with the hotel but I had this feeling that it is slightly overpriced.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: Location is splendid and just on beach (by the way, beach is the most wide one I have ever seen, easily more than 500m), near to local restaurant and to the port. Very nice place to stay although I felt that one night it was sufficient. It is quite calm place, for more nightlife and people go to the Nazare.
reviews.title: Happy New Year

reviews.text: Rooms are not 4 start. It is good 3 starts. Go for sea view as street view overlooks garbage area of the hotel.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Great Value

reviews.text: Overall: good hotel for one night stay over, for longer stays you will find better hotels in other towns on the sea-side. If you like to have calm stay in this quiet city then this is one of the best options.
reviews.title: unexpected good

reviews.text: This is an ancient hotel, where couples and maybe families used to go on glamour vacations for long time periods in this famous beach, Figueira da Foz. As time passed by, people changed habits and the hotel lost most of its glamour. However, the hotel has been remodeled, and we still can feel some of the beach glamour from the old days. It’s a cozy hotel, very comfortable, excellent prices, excellent breakfast and, most of all, excellent view over the beach and the sea. The staff was very professional. Maybe is not headed for for large families, since the rooms are not big, but we did well (two adults and two small children). This city might have lost most of its reputation but, staying in this hotel I can imagine what it might have been once.
reviews.title: A taste of the glamour that has been lost
As good as it gets
reviews.text: If you - for some reason - find yourself in what appears to be a faded Figueira Da Foz, you will do well at the modern and nice Mercure. Ocean view balcony, good breakfast, public swimming pool next door (for some strange reason as COLD as the sea - are they maschocists?) 10 minutes walk to the sea cross a w-i-d-e beach right in front of the hotel. No hotel parking, but with a little luck you can park free in front of the hotel. Nice staff, professional approach. Clean and big rooms. Bar on the poor side - cocktails not a core competence. Follow the road to the right outside the hotel for a 5 minutes drive for a wonderful mountain view of the bay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to (!) go to Figueira again - I would be back at the Mercure. Sort of a compensation.
reviews.title: A good hotel, some little things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lot of good things. A fairly sized room. Balcony with a sea view. Water cooker. Good AC, Hair dryer. Make up mirror. Fast free WiFi at the room. Good bed. Good breakfast included, Flat screen TV. Then the small things. Hangers are cheap, why there are not enough. There was lot of room for them. In the bathroom we had two disposable cheapest kind of "glass". We had the same for 6 days with tooth paste stains. We had also one disposable plastic teaspoon by the water cooker when we came and then nothing. When I used the sugar, no more came. I had my own with me. Probably these are not the company policy but our cleaning ladys. She otherwise excelled in her job at the last day before the tipping. Our bed was done nicely etc. We had a small water bottle from the hotel when we came and then on the last day. Cleaning lady again? I needed assistance for finding a shop for Fado cd. The lady at the the check in desk was not very helpful. Our cleaning lady got her tip and yes, I recommend this hotel. The big things were OK. (No swimming pool and the sea water is cold)
reviews.title: £40 for a seaview room - bargin

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 weeks it was absolutely fantastic , the hotel is located close to the beach and we had an amazing view from the bedroom balcony.AS we walked into the hotel the staff provided us with a warm welcome & interesting and helpfull deals.Bedrooms were quite big and very clean also all of the staff were really nice. Its a really nice relaxing location and we had an amazing holiday.
reviews.title: BRILLIANT <3
The nice beach hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated near the beach. The hotel is nice, clean. Our room had the seaview. The room is big, the bed is comfortable.

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.text: The breafast was nice. The personnel is helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel only some places to park the car in the front of the building. There is no garage. We arrived about 8 p.m and had no place to park the car!
reviews.title: Thouroughly enjoyed our stay here would go back

description: The Mercure Figueira da Foz is a 4 star hotel located right on the Praia da Claridade in the centre of Figueira da Foz, 300 m from the Figueira da Foz Casino. The hotel offers 102 rooms including one suite, as well as a restaurant, bar and meeting rooms.Relax in the restaurant or bar with a beautiful view of the beach. The hotel is decorated with an understated nautical theme. Ideal for a business trip or holiday to the Figueira da Foz region to discover marvellous beaches and Serra da Boa Viagem.
